title: DLK test cases are complicated
body:
I would like to add new tests for AArch64 (related #335 )
But current DLK tests are very complicated.

First of all, we have many test cases of [test_code_generation.py](https://github.com/blue-oil/blueoil/blob/c3689d4e63b88d12c9a27291ee7a21cbe204bedf/dlk/tests/test_code_generation.py)
These tests create a binary file and run a script with binary on each x86_64, ARM and ARM_FPGA environment.
It is too difficult to understand what test cases are run, and too hard to add new devices for similar test cases.

Currently, these test cases are run.

| Task | Model | x86_64 | ARM | ARM_FPGA |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| classification | lmnet_v1_group_conv | o | - | - |
| classification | lmnet_quantize_cifar10 | o | - | - |
| classification | lmnet_quantize_cifar10_space_to_depth | o | o | o |
| classification | resnet_quantize_cifar10 | o | o | o |
| object_detection | fyolo_quantize_4_v4 | o | o | o |
| object_detection | widerface_320 | - | o | - |
| object_detection | widerface_v5 | - | o | - |
| segmentation | lm_segnet_v1_quantize_camvid | o | - | - |

Wow, segmentation task is not tested on ARM, FPGA ðŸ˜­ 

These Models are found on [dlk/examples](https://github.com/blue-oil/blueoil/tree/master/dlk/examples) directory, and these `.pb` files are too old, so we should update and replace them!

I am planning to make the latest `.pb` files of current stable networks supported by blueoil (ref: [blueoil/blueoil_init.py](https://github.com/blue-oil/blueoil/blob/master/blueoil/blueoil_init.py#L33-L56)).
So the test cases will be as follows.
 
| Task | Model | x86_64 | ARM | ARM_FPGA |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| classification | LmnetV1Quantize | o | o | o |
| classification | ResNetQuantize | o | o | o |
| object_detection | LMFYoloQuantize | o | o | o |
| segmentation | LmSegnetV1Quantize | o | o | o |
